comment: she was not able to explain things, but because it was very easy, i was able to pass, but all of the work, she did not explain, and when we did projects, she would take them from a teachers pay teachers website. the projects would make no sense, and she would get mad when people didn't understand what to do.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Whatever yall say I love this girl.

This class was a waste of time with her. This was not suppose to be a hard class and she made it hard. The first day of class we got yelled at. After the first week, she was late to every class or exactly on time. There are only 2 tests and a group project. Never grades anything and didn't give anything back or post any grades until the last day.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Tests? Not many

comment: Rushes through PowerPoints. Notes and PPT dont correlate with tests. Expects you to know full concepts before she explains them. Gets off topic a lot. Gives no sympathy on extra credit.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Tests are tough

comment: She tells you what is in the test blatantly in class at least 3 times a week. I don't know if all the people leaving reviews are just upset or frustrated but she literally teaches straight from the concepts in the book. Word for word she said I teach on the concepts first the next the math. Although I spent 3-4 hours every night but I expected that
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: The lectures are basically her speeding through powerpoint slides and lets you take pics sometimes. She doesn't post anything to help with the chapters and expect you to do everything on your own. Read the sections she covers in class and use MasteringChem to practice for her exams. Study before exam days, otherwise you won't make it in her class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I am usually really good at chemistry, however, Dr. Hypolite makes this class overbearingly hard.   Even if you read the entire textbook and do all the homework on mastering chemistry, she creates her own questions and makes them really confusing to understand, making the tests way harder than they should be.  DO NOT TAKE HER EVER.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Barely talks about her slides (even skips through a few), and expects you to remember every little thing from chem 1211. The tests are all inferring questions (you have to know why something is the way it is). Needless to say, half the class dropped after  the first test and I wasnt far behind them.
Good luck future lads.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: If you want to teach yourself chemistry, go ahead and take her. she teaches barely anything that shows up on the tests. If you don't read every chapter in the book you will fail. Run away, run far away from her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: In the words of Iron Maiden, "Run to the hills. Run for your life!" if you have to take her. Seriously, drop the class and find another professor. Not worth your time or effort. You can easily put in half the work and get the same letter grade with another professor. Stay far away!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: She speaks  in a condescending manner, likes to talk about how she is 'INSPIRATIONAL',  doesn't teach anything, her professional credentials seem questionable to me. Thanks god I had only lab with her, Chem2 is a hard class to teach yourself. Doesn't give a max grade for lab reports no matter how good they are, harder to keep an A. Still, got  A.

Worst. Professor. Ever. I only went to class for the first month then stopped because I wasn't learning anything from her lectures. I had to teach myself everything from the book. Don't take her if you can't teach yourself chemistry.

Not helpful what so ever.  Office hours are at 8 am but she will be late and will stop her office hours to "prepare for lecture" at 8:35am.  The amount of mastering chem hw is ridiculous, but if you do a few things out of class it is possible to get some extra credit, but overall, you will have to read the entire book and be extremely self motivate

Do not take her, especially during summer. The amount of homework and studying during the 15 week semester was AWFUL, so imagining doing that in about half the time (8 week summer semester) is nightmare inducing. If your only options are taking her or graduating late, do yourself a favor and graduate late. She's not even worth being a last resort.

If for some reason you don't believe all these reviews, just type her name into the search box at the top and see the reviews of her  when she taught at other colleges. I BEG YOU, switch to Baker (best) or Baruah (2nd best)!!! If you cannot, get ready for tons of stress and frustration for a much lower than expected grade.

She spends so much time trying to be "inspirational" that she forgets she has to teach.  SO MUCH online hw, & she's no help at all if you are struggling. Lecture was 50 minutes, and tests were 30+ questions. It worries me that she has a doctorate in education because it makes you think if it was a legitimate degree. A monkey could teach better.

If you take her, be ready to learn alone. I would not take her again. If I had the choice to either graduate late or take her class, I would graduate late. It is not impossible to pass, but be ready for stress. Unclear about the grading. Changed it at the end of the semester. Tests were HARD, but not impossible. Also, she assigns TONS of homework.

While her lectures were occasionally hard to follow, I felt that Dr. Hypolite was very encouraging and not condescending in the least! However, she's not going to give you an A, you will have to work for it. If you read every chapter, do the homework, and ask questions, you will do well.

This is a review for her lab, NOT lecture! In lab, she is slightly strict at first, but is a VERY easy grader. You can come in late and she won't care, and will give you credit even if you give the wrong answers. She hardly checked pre-lab materials. Take her for lab, but avoid her lecture! From what I've heard, her lecture is a death.

The class average on the first test was 70, and she said she was "proud" because it was a passing average. Never curves AT ALL, and truly does not know how to teach. It boggles my mind how she even got this job. The online homework will make you want to punch holes in your walls, so stay on top of it. Avoid her by all means necessary!

She's very easy & laid-back for lab, but for lecture, she is probably one of the worst Gen Chem II professors in the whole country. Never curves tests, even if the class average is a failing one, & no sort of extra credit. The online homework is difficult, time-consuming, & pointless in terms of what will be on the exam. Avoid her like the plague!

Absolutely will never take this professor again.  Rude in class to students.  Can't ask questions or you will be humiliated because you "should know this by now." This is already a very tough subject, and you go through alot of material, I am going to retake even if I pass just because I would actually like to learn the material.

Do NOT take her class unless you have to. Karen Hypolite is extremely rude, unhelpful and strives to make you feel like you don't belong in stem I.e. ("This is easy" "why don't you get this"). You will have about 6hour of homework a week. She also spends her class self promoting and gloating at her "accomplishments". Changed majors because of her.

I had her for lab. First she pretended to be strict, but she just wants you to take her (and her class) seriously. Super easy grader. As long as you had an answer she would give you credit, regardless if you had the answer or work correct. Would absolutely take for lab again. She lets you walk in 15 minutes late. Doesn't regularly check for prelab.

Honestly the worst professor I've ever had. However, this class is designed for students to pass it, regardless of the professor. On that note, she makes it as hard as possible for no reason. She has no idea how to lecture, she simply reads the powerpoint slides and moves on. She'll put up examples on the slides and say good luck, she deosnt solve
Please, take anybody but her. The department needs to realize that she is an awful teacher and should not have a job.

Only take her as a last resort! The hw (which contained 40+ questions, each with sub questions) will not be a helpful study guide for the test, yet is mandatory. I had to teach myself from the book. With my hectic schedule, and since the hw wasn't really a helpful study tool, I sometimes had to prioritize on doing the hw vs actually studying.

Worst teacher I've ever had because: -doesn't explain math problems whatsoever -reads off of powerpoints without going into detail -condescending and talks about herself half the time -ignores questions/answers a question with another question -mastering chem and the book are your only hope believe me, you can make a higher grade by not showing up

Honestly, if you want to fail chemistry please take her. She does not teach well at all. If you do not use the book you will fail by far. She has made me hate life. I have seen people get better grades on tests not showing up to class rather than showing up to every single one. Take her as last resort and even then think about art history.

Pros: -She's willing to help if you ask.   Cons -Covers the topics VERY fast. -Jumps around the material a lot.  -Can be condescending when answering questions.  -Her course offers no SI sessions.   I only recommend you take her if you're a chemistry major or if you're very good with chemistry, otherwise you WILL have a VERY tough time.
Don't take her

Makes everything harder than it should be. She thinks that chemistry is the only class you are taking and makes her class much harder than other professors. Her lectures do not teach anything. Only way to pass her class is to teach yourself from the book, but don't bother taking her if you can avoid it

Would not take this professor if I were you. She ignored my answers and questions in class even after asking multiple times. Late to test day, which for a 50 minute class is detrimental. She goes through her powerpoints very quickly and you can't write anything down so you will have to read from the book. I really would not take this professor.

Clearly a very intelligent woman, but cannot teach well. She teaches the material as if we already have a chemistry degree and she is just reviewing the material. Always runs over class time. If you want to pass, you are basically going to have to teach yourself from the book.

She is not that goof of a teacher. She thinks that we already know the stuff and doesn't slow down. Only recommend her if you are natural at chemistry. Her MasteringChemistry homework are harder than the test and completely irrelevant to the class. THERE ARE NO CURVES ON ANY OF HER TEST, YOU HAVE TO WORK SUPER SUPER HARD TO PASS.

Fantastic professor. She is willing to help, if you are willing to ask for it. The labs are easy but do require you to really pay attention during the lab. Calculations can be difficult, but she will explain them to you. Just make sure you do the quizzes and procedure before coming to class, otherwise you will be sent out. Do not skip class.

First thing out of her mouth was "I wouldn't want my doctor to have passed a class on a curve if they're saving my life" so take that as you will. Goes through her custom notes VERY FAST and does not post them online anywhere for review. No SI either. It's definitely up to you to do well.
